meanings.definition: A natural earth pigment containing ferric oxide, typically with clay, varying in color from pale yellow to red or brown.
meanings.sent1: The artist used ocher to create the beautiful sunset painting.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the cave were adorned with ancient drawings made using ocher.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child mistook ocher for chocolate and tried to take a bite.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks flushed with embarrassment, turning a shade of ocher.
meanings.sent5: The ocher pigment added a warm and rustic touch to the artwork.

meanings.definition: A moderate yellow-orange to orange color.
meanings.sent1: The autumn leaves displayed a vibrant ocher hue.
meanings.sent2: She painted her room in a cheerful ocher shade.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy cat rolled around in the ocher sand, blending in perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun cast an ocher glow over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The ocher color of the dress complemented her skin tone beautifully.
